comments.html:
I agree with all you wrote (and netlab already has "import with policy" option, but I haven't implemented it for IOS/XR yet), but that's not an excuse to make the configuration commands so inconsistent.

They could have easily gone with "simple redistribute only, use RPL for more complex stuff" instead. Unfortunately, once you have the first big customers, that opportunity is gone (unless you're Nokia -- https://blog.ipspace.net/2025/04/api-data-model-contract/)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
It's really been a long time since did something with redistribution in IOS-XR, but I guess you should be able to archive what you want to do by using a Route-Policy. So essentially redistribute everything and do everything else in the Route-Policy.

RPL is probably the main reason why such things work a bit differently in IOS-XR than in classic IOS. I agree that this is cumbersome for templates, but personally I look at IOS-XR the same way I look at NX-OS: Completely different NOS (and the "IOS" in the name is more marketing than anything, imho).
